for half an hour i met with no obstacle . i tried to recognise my way by the form of the tunnel , by the projections of certain rocks , by the disposition of the fractures . but no particular sign appeared , and i soon saw that this gallery could not bring me back to the turning point . it came to an abrupt end . i struck against an impenetrable wall , and fell down upon the rock .

the next day , when felton entered milady ’s apartment he found her standing , mounted upon a chair , holding in her hands a cord made by means of torn cambric handkerchiefs , twisted into a kind of rope one with another , and tied at the ends . at the noise felton made in entering , milady leaped lightly to the ground , and tried to conceal behind her the improvised cord she held in her hand .
several times lord de winter , porthos , or aramis , tried to talk with the man in the red cloak ; but to every interrogation which they put to him he bowed , without response .

" let us try it without losing a moment , " replied cyrus harding .
i tried again to sleep ; but my heart beat anxiously : my inward tranquillity was broken .
milady let her head sink between her two hands , and tried to recall her ideas , whirling in a mortal vertigo .

the professor nodded slowly and uneasily like a man that declines to be convinced . i tried to resume the conversation . he answered not a word , and gave the signal for a start . i saw that his silence was nothing but ill - humour .

d’artagnan tried with his sweetest smile to touch his lips to milady ’s , but she evaded him .
d’artagnan detained her by her night dress of fine india linen , to implore her pardon ; but she , with a strong movement , tried to escape .
felton offered the weapon to milady , who examined the temper of it attentively , and who tried the point on the tip of her finger .

she then tried to seize the sword with her hands ; but d’artagnan kept it free from her grasp , and presenting the point , sometimes at her eyes , sometimes at her breast , compelled her to glide behind the bedstead , while he aimed at making his retreat by the door which led to kitty ’s apartment .

the first fear of the king of england , charles i , on learning of the death of the duke , was that such terrible news might discourage the rochellais ; he tried , says richelieu in his memoirs , to conceal it from them as long as possible , closing all the ports of his kingdom , and carefully keeping watch that no vessel should sail until the army which buckingham was getting together had gone , taking upon himself , in default of buckingham , to superintend the departure .

lying back in the hansom , with his hat pulled over his forehead , dorian gray watched with listless eyes the sordid shame of the great city , and now and then he repeated to himself the words that lord henry had said to him on the first day they had met , " to cure the soul by means of the senses , and the senses by means of the soul . " yes , that was the secret . he had often tried it , and would try it again now . there were opium dens where one could buy oblivion , dens of horror where the memory of old sins could be destroyed by the madness of sins that were new .
however , we must try to call him back . "
" let us try , " replied pencroft .
milady tried to raise and carry her , but could not do it .
